intro: Dendrobium ovatipetalum, commonly known as the broad-petaled dendrobium, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a compact growth habit with clustered pseudobulbs and linear,革质 (leathery) leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange, typically during the dry season. Its flowers are borne on racemes and have three prominent sepals and petals. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
